post.author: Dormin111
post.title: Modern US Politicians as Late Roman Republic Figures

div.p: Today someone on this thread compared Trump to Julius Caesar, as inspired by Dan Carlin. I can’t help myself…

p.strong: Modern US Politicians as Late Roman Republic Figures:

div.p: Donald Trump = Lucius Cornelius Sulla
- Attempts to restore republic to its glory days through strongman tactics
- Famously generous to friends, notoriously brutal to enemies
- Constantly accused of tyranny
- Wants to be loved by the highest status members of society
- Red/orange hair
- Mocked for his skin
- Known to be sexually successful
- Spent much of his life with shady characters
- Known to associate with prostitutes/pornstars
- His reforms will likely be nullified shortly after leaving office
- Will likely be in ultimate power for a surprisingly short period of time
Barack Obama = Pompey Magnus
- Extraordinarily fast rise to power
- Briefly beloved leader of political class and masses
- Disappointingly bad at politics once in power
- Accused of being all flash, no substance
- Petered out and showed a lot of weakness in his later days, abandoned by supporters
- Runs into trouble in the Middle East
- Succeeded by archrival
Joe Biden = Marcus Tullius Cicero
- Leads the moderates
- Been in politics forever
- Highly respected by colleagues
- Flexible on actual policy, but conservative-minded
- Victorious over radical legislator who sought revolutionary wealth distribution
- Charismatic in his own way, but surpassed by more energetic opponents
Bernie Sanders = Lucius Sergius Cataline
- Radical legislator who wants to enact massive wealth distribution
- Believes political system and society is rigged by monied elites
- Wants to forgive all debts
- Keeps running for top political position, always loses
- Hated by colleagues
- Has small, but fanatical following
- Is rich, but pretends he isn’t
- Defeated by leader of the moderates who wanted to maintain the status quo
Hillary Clinton = Marcus Linus Crassus
- Respected by all, loved by none
- Considered crafty, cold, uncharismatic, better at operating behind the scenes than out front
- Longer political career than most contemporaries
- Conspiratorial
- Considered an advocate of the monied class, but also panders to the masses
- Was top lieutenant of an older dominant political leader
- Gets knocked out of the ultimate political contest surprisingly early
- Runs into trouble in the Middle East
Justin Amash = Cato the Younger
- Famously principled
- Staunch conservative who wants to restore the public through virtue and personal example
- Younger than colleagues
- Always in the legislature, but a fairly low position
- Other people try to get him to run for the top office, but he refuses
- Expected to support nominal political ally who gets top office, but refuses out of principle
- Pisses off moderates
- Will probably never get far in politics
Julius Caesar = Whoever is elected in 2024
- Will take power in the midst of the complete deterioration of political norms
- Will be given extraordinary powers to stop the disorder
- In the attempt to pass sensible structural reforms, will be accused of being a conservative tyrant and a radical revolutionary, simultaneously
- Will have to pass legislation to fix the unbalanced and completely politicized court system
- Will probably only last one term
